comment.author: 8398214@N05
comment._content: The quality of theese shots is great. Could be mistaken for contemporary shots (set aside the technology).

comment.author: 36767100@N08
comment._content: Fredo, a film transparency is equivalent to about 5,000 lpi resolution. It's more like today's digital technology is catching up with the old quality.

comment.author: 8398214@N05
comment._content:
Right. But I was not commenting on the image resolution. Besides, on a image resolution this small (500x400) such a source resolution is pointless. My purpose was rather to comment image quality such as color balance, hue and definition, which in my opinion is quite remarkable for an exposure taken in the 1940's. In refering to the "technology", I was refering to the tanks... 

Regards.

comment.author: 32938615@N08
comment._content: Hi Alfred, a great shot! I like it very much! Maybe you would like to post some of your pictures on www.military-vehicle-photos.com I think the visitors over there would like that very much. Regards, Alf , The Netherlands.
